content.description: This is the biggest roof at The Quarries. There are several variations, and all are intimidating. The upper 12 feet fell off in the '90s making the climb harder than when it was first lead by Eric Engberg, in 1982, saying at the time it was 5.9.
content.location: This is on the climber's left end under the big roof. It is hard to miss.

climbs.name: East of Eden
climbs.fa: TR- Bob Seymour, lead- Barry Rugo

content.description: This is a tough and intimidating line that was much tried before success. It has a bit of a swing on TR. Barry SOLOED! this route as well!!! WOW.
content.protection: This has some fixed pins, use double ropes for sure.
content.location: This line goes out the big overhang. A hard hand traverse starts the fun and is followed by sustained and powerful moves up and out several bulges.

content.description: Climb up the left side of the slab towards the overhang. Then pull up through the overhang and continue directly up.
content.protection: There are two bolted hangers at the top of route for your anchor.
content.location: The start of the route is climber's left of the pond on the ground.

content.description:
This section of the Quarries has one of the harder problems here.  The rock has failed on the left side of this face.  Its appearance does not lend great faith to a climber. 

  L->R: 

  A. Dirty (fallen down)   B. ClevelandÂ’s Climb (fallen down)   C. Tectonic Plates, 9+ (?fallen down)   D. Under The Big Top, 10 PG-13, 45', gear or TR.   E. East of Eden, 12-, 55', gear or TR.   F. Slice of Lime, 6   G. Fruit of the Loom, 10   H. Orange Peel Easy, 7   IH. Orange Peel, 8   J. Canada Dry, 8   K. Parabola, 10
